trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}<100

item.name: CPU Fan Status
item.description: Returns error if CPU fan fails.

item.name: Load Avg 1 min
item.description: 1 minute load.

item.name: Load Avg 5 min
item.description: 5 minute load.

item.name: Load Avg 15 min
item.description: 15 minute load.

item.name: Model Name
item.description: Model name of this NAS.

item.name: Power Status
item.description: Returns error if power supplies fail

item.name: Serial Number
item.description: Model serial number

item.name: CPU Idle
item.description: The percentage of processor time spent idle, calculated over the last minute.

item.name: CPU System
item.description: The percentage of CPU time spent processing system-level code, calculated over the last minute.

item.name: CPU User
item.description: The percentage of CPU time spent processing user-level code.

item.name: System Fan Status
item.description: Returns error if system fan fails.

item.name: System Status
item.description: System partition status.

item.name: System Temperature
item.description: Temperature of this NAS.

item.name: Upgrade Available
item.description: Checks whether a new version or update of DSM is available

item.name: Version
item.description: The version of DSM

item.name: Total Physical Available
item.description: The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.

item.name: Total Swap Available
item.description: The amount of swap space currently unused or available.

item.name: Total Buffer Memory
item.description: The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers.

item.name: Total Cached Memory
item.description: The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory.

item.name: Total Shared Memory
item.description: The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as shared memory.

item.name: Total Free Memory
item.description: The total amount of memory free or available for use on this host.

item.name: Total Physical Memory
item.description: The total amount of real/physical memory installed on this host.

item.name: Total Swap Space
item.description: The total amount of swap space configured for this host.

item_prototype.name: Storage Size on {#IFDESCR}
item_prototype.description: The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: Storage Used on {#IFDESCR} (%)
item_prototype.description: % of disk space used.

item_prototype.name: Storage Used on {#IFDESCR}
item_prototype.description: The amount of the storage represented by this entry.

item_prototype.name: Incomming Packets on Interface {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing Packets on Interface {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface.

discovery_rule.name: Synology SpaceIO
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing a device and its statistics.

item_prototype.name: Space Load of Disk {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The load of disk in the volume (%).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} byte(s) read since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes read from this volume since boot (32-bit ver.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} read access(es) since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of read accesses from this volume since boot.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} write accesses since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of write accesses to this volume since boot (32-bit ver.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} byte(s) written since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes written to this volume since boot (32-bit ver.).

discovery_rule.name: Synology StorageIO
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing a device and its statistics.

item_prototype.name: Storage Load on Disk {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The load of disk (in %).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} byte(s) read since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes read from this device since boot (32-bit VER.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} byte(s) written since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes written to this device since boot (32-bit VER.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} read access(es) since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of read accesses from this device since boot (32-bit VER.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} write access(es) since boot
item_prototype.description: The number of write accesses from this device since boot (32-bit VER.).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Model
item_prototype.description: Synology disk model name: the disk model name will be showed here.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Status
item_prototype.description: Synology disk status: each meanings of status represented describe below: [1] Normal: the hard disk functions normally. [2] Initialized: the hard disk has system partition but no data. [3] NotInitialized: the hard disk does not have system in system partition. [4] SystemPartitionFailed: the system partitions on the hard disks are damaged. [5] Crashed: the hard disk has damaged.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} partition damaged
trigger_prototype.description: Partitions on the disk are damaged

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Temperature
item_prototype.description: Synology disk temperature: the temperature of each disk uses Celsius degree.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Type
item_prototype.description: Synology disk type: the type of disk will be showed here, including SATA, SSD and so on.

discovery_rule.name: Synology Disk(s) SMART
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing a disk SMART information.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk SMART attribute {#ATTRNAME} state was changed on {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Synology iSCSI LUN
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing iscsi lun information.

item_prototype.name: Disk Latency Read on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN read disk latency.

item_prototype.name: Disk Latency Write on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN write disk latency.

item_prototype.name: IOPS Read on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN read iops.

item_prototype.name: IOPS Write on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN write iops.

item_prototype.name: IO Size Read on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN average io size when reading.

item_prototype.name: IO Size Write on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN average io size when writing.

item_prototype.name: Network Latency TX on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN network tx latency.

item_prototype.name: Throughput Read High on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN read throughput over 32 bits part.

item_prototype.name: Throughput Read Low on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: LUN read throughput over 32 bits part.

item_prototype.name: Throughput Write High on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: The higher 32 bit of write throughput.

item_prototype.name: Throughput Write Low on LUN {#LUNNAME} ({#LUNUID})
item_prototype.description: The lower 32 bit of write throughput.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Users
item_prototype.description: Number of users using this service.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} RAID Name
item_prototype.description: Synology raid name: the name of each raid will be showed here.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} RAID Status
item_prototype.description: Synology Raid status: each meanings of status represented describe below: [1] Normal: the raid functions normally. [11] Degrade: degrade happens when a tolerable failure of disk(s) occurs. [12] Crashed: raid has crashed and just uses for read-only operation. Note: other status will be showed when creating or deleting raids, including below status: [2] Repairing, [3] Migrating, [4] Expanding, [5] Deleting, [6] Creating(6), [7] RaidSyncing, [8] RaidParityChecking, [9] RaidAssembling and [10] Canceling.

trigger_prototype.name: Raid status on {HOSTNAME}: abnormal
trigger_prototype.description: Repairing(2) Migrating(3) Expanding(4) Deleting(5) Creating(6) RaidSyncing(7) RaidParityChecking(8) RaidAssembling(9) Canceling(10)

trigger_prototype.name: Raid status on {HOSTNAME}: crashed
trigger_prototype.description: RAID has crashed and is now read-only.

trigger_prototype.name: Raid status on {HOSTNAME}: degrade
trigger_prototype.description: Degrade is shown when a tolerable failure of disk(s) occurs.
